subject: Relaxation of Sanction limits for making payments till 31.12.2019
text: HRd4 <ch <TTHrf gfearrut 7414 / Phone 91-11-25074100/25074200 (s* war7 ak {TTHTf H14) 444 / Fax 91-11-25093507 25093514 National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways) vit-5 Qa 6, Vaer-10, aRGT, 7 fcrif-110075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 NHAIPolicy Guidelines/Finanance/2019 Policy Circular No. 3.2.11/2019 Dated 18-hNovember , 2019 [Decision taken in File No. NHAI/GM (Fin. ) /Budget/2019] Sub: Relaxation of Sanction limits for making payments till 31.12.2019 reg: Earlier, various policy circulars were issued for regularisation of excess expenditure incurred over & above the Sanction Amount. However , it is noted that for some of the projects, the exercise is to be completed: Recently, Board of NHAI has approved a delegation for  regularising the excess expenditure for pre-construction costs in ongoing projects and the Policy Guidelines No. 7.1.63/2019 dated 18.11.2019 have already been issued. 2 _ Regularization of excess expenditure incurred over & above the Sanction Amount shall be completed on or before 31.12.2019. It is expected that by giving this relaxation upto 31.12.2019, all regularization cases shall be processed and necessary approvals shall be obtained by the concerned Project Division. 3 While giving this relaxation to the Sanction Amount, budget checks would continue An example for checking of Sanction amount and Budget under one particular head of expenditure in Accounting Financial Management System (AFMS) is illustrated below Case 1- Sanction Amount Rs. 120 Cr Budget Amount (BE 19-20) Rs. 100 Cr System will allow payment upto Rs. 100 Cr only  during this Financial Year due to Budget check though Sanction Amount is available.
